alert.note: Alert for Northern Grafton; Southern Coos; Southern Grafton (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 10:18AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Grafton County through 1045 AM EDT... At 1017 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles east of Piermont to near Enfield. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lebanon, Lincoln, Plymouth, Grafton, Hanover, Haverhill, Enfield, Canaan, Holderness, Ashland, Danbury, Groton, Woodstock, Piermont, Sandwich, Bristol, Grantham, Bartlett, Lyme, and Alexandria. This includes the following highways... Interstate 89 between mile markers 47 and 60. Interstate 93 between mile markers 75 and 101. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Northern Grafton; Southern Coos; Southern Grafton
